thread.title: UGA ranked among CFB's Top-10 programs of last 20 years
thread.title_full: UGA ranked among CFB's Top-10 programs of last 20 years

title: UGA ranked among CFB's Top-10 programs of last 20 years
text:
UGA ranked among CFB's Top-10 programs of last 20 years Georgia is among college football's best programs in the last two decades. Slot to Georgia Links 
According to the Massey Consensus rankings, which were developed by statistician Kenneth Massey, Georgia is the nation's No. 6 program over the last 20 years. 
In a set of rankings based on the average ranking over the past 20 years, Ohio State is college football's top program over that time span followed by FSU, Oklahoma, Florida, LSU, UGA, USC, Oregon, Alabama and Virginia Tech. 
Best 20-year average Massey Consensus ranking:1.Ohio St Not a member? Try a seven-day FREE trial to VIP access to Dawgs247! 
Alabama is notably low on the list but that shouldn't come as a surprised. While the Crimson Tide has been a juggernaut since Nick Saban's second season in Tuscaloosa in 2008, it struggled mightily from the late 1990 through 2007. 
Georgia, however, has seen results that trend in the opposite direction. That's why Alabama is the nation's top program over the last 10 years while UGA is outside of the top 10. 
(What's next for the Bulldogs? Make sure you're in the loop -- take a few moments to sign up for our FREE Bulldogs Newsletter! ) Author
